name: DomainTools Iris Investigate
description: This app supports investigative actions to profile domain names, get risk scores, and find connected domains that share the same Whois details, web hosting profiles, SSL certificates, and more on DomainTools Iris Investigate

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity
Evaluates the risk of a given domain

domain.description: Domain or comma-separated list of domains to query

actions.description: Find domains connected by any supported Iris Investigate search parameter

status.description: Return domains of this registration type

data_updated_after.description: Iris Investigate records that were updated on or after midnight on this date, in YYYY-MM-DD format or relative options ( 'today', 'yesterday' )

tld.description: Limit results to only include domains in a specific top-level domain (i.e. “tld=com” or “tld=ru”)

create_date.description: Only include domains created on a specific date, in YYYY-MM-DD format or relative options ( 'today', 'yesterday' )

create_date_within.description: Only include domains with a whois create date within the specified number of days (e.g. specifying '1' would indicate within the past day)
create_date_within.name: create_date_within

first_seen_within.description: Only include domains with a current lifecycle first observed within the specified number of seconds (e.g. specifying '86400' would indicate within the past day)
first_seen_within.name: first_seen_within

first_seen_since.description: Only include domains with a current lifecycle first observed since a specified datetime. (Example: 2023-04-10T00:00:00+00:00)
first_seen_since.name: first_seen_since

expiration_date.description: Only include domains expiring on a specific date, in YYYY-MM-DD format or relative options ( 'today', 'yesterday' )

actions.description: Extract IPs from a single domain response for further pivoting

domain.description: Domain or comma-separated list of domains to query

actions.description: Find domains with web hosting IP, NS IP or MX IP

status.description: Return domains of this registration type

actions.description: Load or monitor Iris Investigate search results by Iris Investigate export hash

search_hash.description: Paste the "Current Search Export" string (Advanced -> Import/Export Search) from Iris Investigate in this field to import up to 5000 domains

actions.description: Find domains with email in Whois, DNS SOA or SSL certificate

status.description: Return domains of this registration type

actions.description: Get all Iris Investigate data for a domain using the Iris Investigate API endpoint (required)

domain.description: Domain or comma-separated list of domains to query using the Iris Investigate API

actions.description: Get all Iris Investigate data for a domain except counts using the high volume Iris Enrich API endpoint (if provisioned)

domain.description: Domain or comma-separated list of domains to query using the Iris Enrich API (if provisioned)

actions.description: Run on initial setup to configure the optional monitoring playbooks. This action creates a custom list to manage the playbook scheduling and run status
Execute scheduled playbooks based on the set interval(mins) in 'domaintools_scheduled_playbooks' custom list. Smaller intervals will result in more accurate schedules
Apex-level domains (e.g. example.com but not www.example.com) observed for the first time by the DomainTools sensor network, and which are not present in our DNSDB historical database

domain.description: Used to filter feed results. The filter can be an exact match or a partial match when the * character is included at the beginning and/or end of the value.

after.description: A negative integer (in seconds) representing the start of the time window, relative to the current time in seconds, for which data will be provided.

session_id.description: Serves as a unique identifier for the session. This parameter ensures that data retrieval begins from the latest timestamp recorded in the previous data pull.

top.description: The number of results to return in the response payload. Primarily used for testing.

actions.description: Apex-level domains (e.g. example.com but not www.example.com) DomainTools has newly observed in our DNS sensor network. This includes domains observed in DNS for the first time as well as domains observed in DNS again after not being observed for at least 10 days

domain.description: Used to filter feed results. The filter can be an exact match or a partial match when the * character is included at the beginning and/or end of the value.

after.description: A negative integer (in seconds) representing the start of the time window, relative to the current time in seconds, for which data will be provided.

session_id.description: Serves as a unique identifier for the session. This parameter ensures that data retrieval begins from the latest timestamp recorded in the previous data pull.

top.description: The number of results to return in the response payload. Primarily used for testing.
